4.9.20  8:49 pm   during this quarantine, I think you could help people out by answering, what are some things you can do with bread inside? I have a prototype list attached.

-Eat Bread
-Drink Bread
-Fix Bread (With Bread Glue)
-Make a model plane out of Bread
-Fly the Plane to-
Wait no
Nix that last one
Stay inside
Don't leave the house
Be Safe, thanks for your help

-philosopher of bread,
Jammeson Wheatus

     the thing about this quarantine, if you truly are trying to stay isolated as much as possible, bread seems not ideal. because it doesn't last very long

4.9.20  7:03 pm   It's just occurred to me that someone could ask you what number the countdown timer is at, and you could just not publish the question, ultimately having full control over the countdown timer. Now I know you make it up anyway, but do you actually have a rough idea when the countdown timer will be up?... What number is it at now? 

     IT HAS ENTERED A STATE OF HIGH ALERT

4.9.20  6:16 pm   I tried figuring out the chords to this reaaaally cool part in "Hello Sexy Pants" and it goes like this: "Simon says(F-G#-C-Eb) I can't remember (C#-Eb-F#-G#) anything I'm doing (B-C#-E-F#) or anything that I remember (G-B-D-F#). Hopefully you don't have to listen to your own song in order to help me here but I'm curious if these are the actual chords or just chords I like that sound good when played at the same time as the song. Maybe this doesn't matter since I already like it

4.9.20  4:37 pm   that method you outlined for recording a band separately, is that how you record your stuff?

     yes

     / do you have any tips for recording stuff separately as one person?

     it is exactly the same advice, what with making the rounds and going back and forth. that way you can create the illusion that all the players heard each other, rather than just each person hearing only the previous and the first person hearing nothing. as you keep touching it up all the way round, it starts to really sound genuine

4.9.20  4:09 pm   People are telling to draw from "imagination". But is that even possible? I always have to have a model or to take random words to have an inspiration or to look at an object. Do I lack something to make something that comes out of "nowhere"/my imagination?

     imagination from a total void might be somewhat rare. you are right in noticing that it is extremely useful and friendly to have some cross pollination, between your imagination and the imagination of the wider world

4.9.20  1:58 pm   which software are you learning?

     at this point i almost feel as if i am teaching it, to do things

4.9.20  1:49 pm   what has writing/producing those really short (<= 10 seconds) songs done for you? I'm doing that now because I am really bad at developing a melody but really good at coming up with a short melodic phrase and producing it to sound really fun and interesting. I think it is making me better somehow. I would also like to know how you learned to create longer songs that develop the melody and go to other places. It's hard for me to write stuff that doesn't "end" as quickly as it started.

     the reason for doing this when starting out is simple. especially when working alone, the riddles and challenges grow exponentially with the piece length. so it's gonna get real hopeless real fast if you are trying to learn everything all at once. My advice for something longer, at the risk of being very obvious advice, i would suggest increase the length in extremely small increments. make each one 1 second longer. i think you will learn a lot

4.9.20  9:42 am   I'm writing poetry, and often when I start off it feels like some of my weirder ideas just sound willfully eccentric and obscure, or just whimsical, quirk, wordiness for the sake of it. Houw do you strike that balance between free form surrealy stuffs, without distracting from the thing as a whole ?

     one approach is to try to get way way way way too surreal, and then wait for the inevitable epic surprise when the meaning suddenly shines through anyway, with the power of 1000 suns

      I would also like to say that it is very nice that you have this page where you make an effort to be nice to people.

     are you challenging me to a duel of niceness

4.9.20  9:33 am   are you mentally stable?

     i will be discussing it with my team

4.9.20  9:33 am   How do dreams work?

     they are made up

4.9.20  9:30 am   why are your videos and songs so catchy?

     to increase the likelyhood that you will catch them

4.9.20  9:19 am   Are you slowly losing it in quarantine?

     no, i briefly did in around september 2008 and then quickly got over it because i realized how much important work i have ahead of me
